availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The commonwealth of Kentucky
To the Sheriff of Bath County greeting

You are hereby commanded that of the estate of Thomas A Beckner Wm H Arnett & Charles Beckner late of your bailiwick you cause to be made the sum of Three Hundred & thirteen Dollars & 90cts with interest thereon ofat the rate of six per cent per annum, from the 29th day of June 1860 until paid which
The Commonwealth of Kentucky lately in our Clark Circuit Court recovered against them for debt, By virtue of a Replevin Bond, Also $1.60cts which to the said Commonwealth was adjudged for cost in their behalf expended whereof the said Beckner &c are convicts as appears to us of record, and that you have the same before the Judge of our Clark circuit Court at the Court house in Winchester on the Saturday succeeding the fourth Monday in May next to render unto said Commonwealth in the debt interest and cost aforesaid, and have then there this writ. Witness Aylett H Buckner Clerk of our said court this 6th day of April 1865 and in the 73rd year of the commonwealth
Only $200, & its Interest & $1,10cts cost of fifa to be collected

Attest
A H Buckner
Clk
A copy

Clark Cir Ct
vs
Thos A. Beckner
$313.90
